snippet: Officials said that the country’s hoard of foreign exchange reserves, a rough proxy for money moving in and out of the nation, grew in March for the first time in five months.
abstract: Data indicates China has stemmed flow of cash leaving country, as it tries to spark slowing economic growth, fix problematical financial system and strengthen is currency; officials say foreign exchange reserves rose in March for first time in five months, to $3.21 trillion.
lead_paragraph: Officials said that the country’s hoard of foreign exchange reserves, a rough proxy for money moving in and out of the nation, grew in March for the first time in five months.

headline.main: China Stanches Flow of Money Out of the Country, Data Suggests
headline.print_headline: China Appears to Stem Tide of Cash Leaving Country
